body_html:
You can also set DYLD_PRINT_ENV and DYLD_PRINT_LIBRARIES env variables (see man dyld). One thing to note is that on El Capitan DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH is not inherited for protected binaries. See e.g.
http://apple.stackexchange.com/questions/215030/el-capitan-make-check-dyld-library-path
So if you are in protected mode that might be causing it to be ignored.
body_text:
You can also set DYLD_PRINT_ENV and DYLD_PRINT_LIBRARIES env variables (see man dyld).  One thing to note is that on El Capitan DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH is not inherited for protected binaries. See e.g.
http://apple.stackexchange.com/questions/215030/el-capitan-make-check-dyld-library-path
So if you are in protected mode that might be causing it to be ignored.
body:
You can also set DYLD_PRINT_ENV and DYLD_PRINT_LIBRARIES env variables (see man dyld).  One thing to note is that on El Capitan DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH is not inherited for protected binaries. See e.g.
http://apple.stackexchange.com/questions/215030/el-capitan-make-check-dyld-library-path
So if you are in protected mode that might be causing it to be ignored.
